Katie's Kep - fair isle hat


RSS feed


This was my first attempt at fair isle knitting and it really was not as bad as I thought it was going to be. I had some difficulty at the beginning figuring out the two colour rib (you can’t just keep your purling colour to the front!) but other than that it was pretty straightforward.

I used the Katie’s Kep pattern - designed by Wilma Malcolmson for this year’s Shetland Wool Week festival (due to be held in September 2020 but cancelled due to COVID-19, of course). The pattern can be downloaded for free here. The pattern is easy to follow if you are a beginner, and there is even a Katie’s Kep knit-along Facebook group if you get stuck (I only discovered the group after I finished knitting my hat!)

I used Jamieson & Smith 2ply jumper weight yarn, as per the pattern instructions (yarn purchased from the Shetland Woolbrokers website).


I love how the hat turned out and think the colours look great!

Peeriegurumi
